metadata.Title: CVE-2013-5717 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The Bluetooth HCI ACL dissector in Wireshark 1.10.x before 1.10.2 does not properly maintain a certain free list, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a crafted packet that is not properly handled by the wmem_block_alloc function in epan/wmem/wmem_allocator_block.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-5717` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.10.2-1
libwireshark3 - 1.10.2-1
libwiretap3 - 1.10.2-1
libwsutil3 - 1.10.2-1
tshark - 1.10.2-1
wireshark - 1.10.2-1
wireshark-common - 1.10.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.2-1').
